item.description:
After our romp through the white wines of the Old World, it's time to continue our journey and follow the footsteps of the ye olden explorers into the New World.  During the Golden Age of Exploration, Europeans headed out to all corners of the globe and brought with them grapes!  One of the first places to grow grapes and produce wine outside of Europe was South Africa with the first wine produced in 1642.

I doubt we'll be able to find a bottle from that vintage, but join us as we sample our way through South Africa's varied white wines.

Appetizer volunteers always welcome

group.name: The MetroWest White Wine Meetup Group

item.name: South Africa Whites
